alert.note: Alert for Cattaraugus; Chautauqua; Genesee; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 9:03PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF CHAUTAUQUA... CATTARAUGUS...ERIE...WYOMING...AND GENESEE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow lake effect snow will continue along much of the Lake Erie shore from Ripley to Angola and Eden, then extending inland across the Chautauqua Ridge, Boston Hills, and the ridges of Wyoming and far southern Genesee counties. Snowfall rates of around 2 inches per hour will continue in the heaviest portion of the band, resulting in visibility of less than a quarter mile and deep snow cover on roads. The northern edge of heavy snow will continue to impact the Buffalo Southtowns from Hamburg to Orchard Park and East Aurora for another hour or two, but the band is starting to drift south and is expected to move south of the Buffalo Southtowns by late evening. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 57 and 61. This includes Route 400 and Route 219. SAFETY INFO... The snow will accumulate so rapidly that it will be extremely difficult for the road crews to keep the roads clear. Be prepared for severe winter driving conditions if you must venture out. &&
